headline: Mini Meatloaves
description: This mini meatloaf recipe is made with ground beef, cheese, and oats formed into individual loaves, then baked until tender with a sweet, tangy glaze.

video.description: Individual loaves of yummy beef, cheese, and oats with a tangy glaze.
video.name: Mini Meatloaves

name: Mini Meatloaves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Stir together cheese, milk, oats, egg, and salt in a large bowl. Mix in ground beef until well combined. Form mixture into 8 mini meatloaves; place in the prepared baking dish.
Combine ketchup, brown sugar, and mustard in a small bowl; stir well. Spread over each meatloaf.
Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (72 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I used muffin tins.. for the sauce I used a little mustard, ketchup and bbq sauce.
PERFECTION!!! :)
I layer the bottom of the pan with sliced potatoes to raise the meatloaf out of the grease. I also add diced onion to the beef mixture.
Excellent i make all time I'm 6 muffin pan good size I leave the cheese out no thanks . I use panko instead of oats . I also add my herbs ams seasoning too .

This has been a favorite recipe for years. The only things I do different are: I add chopped onion and unless I want to wash a lot of the topping down the drain, I make only about half of what the recipe calls for. 2/3 cup of ketchup is way too much for 8 tiny meatloaves.
Very good recipe. Used muffin tins so probably knock down cooking time to 30 minutes.

Now my go to meatloaf. This is fantastic exactly as written. I’ve played around with onions, garlic, parsley, etc, but there is no reason to modify this recipe. I made it for my parents and my 70+ year old dad said “this is the first time I’ve ever eaten meatloaf without putting ketchup on it”. Make this meatloaf!
So easy! And with ingredients on hand. No changes and delicious.
The ketchup mixture on top was WAY too sweet. Probably would cut the sugar in half our out entirely.

Great recipe! Wanna try this one. Thanks for sharing. Would like to share this too, Panlasang Makabayan food restaurant with a twist! Get your Pinoy food favorites and freshly baked bread only here at Ka Tunying's Cafe and Restaurant!" https://katunyings.com/

I've been using this recipe for years, it's 1 of 3 meatloaf recipes I rotate through and my families favorite. I just wanted to say, although I normally follow the recipe exactly, tonight I made it with 1 cup panko breadcrumbs since I didn't have oatmeal and it turned out delicious as well. Thank you for the great recipe!
This recipe is very good. I make three in small loaf pans and freeze two of them. They are a very large meal for us. Thank you.
This has become a staple for my family.

this is a nice variation on the theme of cheese and oatmeal in meatloaf. I always use ground turkey to decrease saturated fat (but then add it back in with the cheese! ha). This recipe has WAAAAAY too much salt. Easy to work with, fun to play around with variety of spices/flavors (Indian, Thai, Mexican...)
My family loves this recipe! I tweak it just a bit to our preferences, but I do that to almost every recipe. A definite family favorite!
we love love love this
It is a great quick dinner for people who don’t spend a lot of time cooking!
Fantastic recipe! I did the mini meatloaves in muffin tins as well, made 12 and baked for 45 min. Big hit in the household, moist and delicious.

Made this exactly as instructed, except I made them in a muffin pan as other commenters did. The meat is delicious, but the sauce was too sweet. A little goes a long way. Next time I'll cut back on the sugar. Not sure it makes the rotation, but will give it another shot.

I love meat loaf but I am the only one in the house who does so I liked the fact that I could divide it into 6 small patties (that seem like the right serving size to me). I did add dry onion soup mix and used Sweet Billy Ray's BBQ sauce on top instead of the ketchup/brown sugar/mustard. I put the BBQ before baking just like the recipe said for the other topping. That would probably be good too. 5 stars for sure! I have never put either oats or shredded Cheddar in meatloaf and those two ingredients worked well.

love this! so much easier to serve individual loafs and faster to cook. my 11 mo LOVED this meatloaf too. i like how i could make hers then add salt and any other special spices my husband and i like. i added BBQ sauce to the top and used a spicy pepper cheese instead.

Found this recipe today and tried it, since it has pretty basic ingredients that I already have. I usually like meatloaf, but it has never been anything I raved over until this. This is so easy to make and so good! I love that the sauce is on each bite when I cut it up and the sauce is delicious too. Sugar makes every meal better. I have this saved as a new favorite to make. I’m adding it to my rotating meals.
One of my favourites
Ate one. Delicious! Good to have around. I recommend this recipe. Easy and good.
It was very good and easy. For the next time, I will definitely add chopped onion and Worcestershire sauce.

Well, I had 2 pounds of ground beef thawed so I doubled the recipe, and ended up making "not-so-mini" meatloaves, but this recipe is stacked!! I added some chopped onions to the meatloaf for a little extra flavor, but this one is really good.

This has been my go-to meatloaf recipe for years. I cut the milk back to 1/4 cup (too soupy otherwise) and added garlic powder and onion powder (or minced onion) as others suggested. I shape it into one loaf.

I love this recipe & I’ve made this several times & it’s always too liquidy to form into loaves so I use a muffin tin each time. Either cut back on the milk to a little more than 1/2 cup or add 1/4 cup more oats (use your judgement). I’ve doubled this recipe today & I would definitely use no more than 1 cup of milk as it was more liquidy than normal. I salvaged it by adding another 1/3-1/2 cup of oats.

This is a fantastic staple at our house. We have a picky eater who doesn’t like cheese. I found that the consistency is just as enjoyable if you omit the cheese and leave all other rations exactly the same. We make them in muffin pans and make extra dinner rolls. They turn into sliders for leftovers and it’s just as fun. Thanks for the recipe!
Way too sweet, even for the kids. No one went back for seconds.

This recipe came out good, but I only gave it 3 stars because I did edit the recipe a little due to all the reviews I had read. I added a little brown mustard on top of the prepared mustard to the sauce to cut the sweetness and I added some onion to the meat mixture to add some flavor since several people mentioned it was bland. The mixture was still a bit liquidy after let the oats soak up some of the juices and mixing everything, so I added some additional oats to be able to form the loaf.

I liked this, but did change a few things. I used panko instead of oats, since that was what I had on hand. I liked the texture, and would definitely use the panko again. I also baked the meatloaves in a muffin tin, as others has suggested (totally fun idea!) I will make changes next time I make this, such as adding pepper, sauteed onions, and garlic to the meat mixture (it is a bit bland). I will also increase the mustard and decrease the brown sugar in the sauce.
It was amazing the only extra seasonings that I added for the meat were Nature Seasoning, a packet of french fried onions, and Bourbon & Brown Sugar Seasoning
Our family favorite!! For time efficiency, I double the recipe, ( not the glaze) and put it into a loaf pan, bake for about an hour. Use a meat thermometer to be sure. This is delicious!
FOLLOW the recipe and the sauce is what makes the recipe good. I put only 1 tablespoon of sauce on each little meatloaf before baking. The rest I served at the table.
This is the absolute BEST MEATLOAF I've ever had in my life - I crave it! I've made several times and I will never make any other way. (I do make into a loaf, not minis). SOOOO GOOD!

Make these often and they're always a hit. Add some chopped green peppers sometimes, but the recipe is delicious exactly as written too. I usually double everything except the sauce, as I've found one batch of sauce is enough for two batches of meatloaf.
Delicious! I substituted saltine crackers for the oatmeal and used muffin tin. Next time I will double the sauce.

Like many others, I used a cupcake tin to make it easier to portion out and the amount worked really well for my family. Adding some garlic and onion powder helped with the flavoring and I added a bit of steak sauce to the glaze just for taste. Overall it was good, and without the onion, it was a winner with picky eaters too. Will likely make it again.

I followed the recipe exactly as given; i did change the serving size, as I had 2 pounds of beef i wanted to use, where the original recipe calls for 1 pound. Unfortunately, the ingredients doubled turns into a soppy mess (I knew 1 1/3 cup of milk looked like a alot of milk!) - i only used half of the wet mixture (cheese, milk, oatmeal, etc.) and even added bread crumbs to thicken up the meat and milk/oatmeal mess; It was terrible and I thought I ruined it completely! I cooked in one large loaf (big mistake!) - this recipe with this topping is meant to be cooked in individual/serving size portions!! Trust me! The taste is amazing with this sugary/BBQ like taste - the kids weren't too thrilled with this trial, but now that I know what NOT to do next time, this will definitely be a staple!
SUGGESTION _ DO NOT DOUBLE!!! Make the recipe in 2 seperate bowls if you have more then 1 pound of meat :)
I have made it gluten free, using Almond flour, and coconut flour. The Family loves it!!!

I have been experimenting with meatloaf recipes and can now stop my search. These were delicious and easy—my hubby said they were the tastiest meat loaves he’s ever had. I had old fashioned oats so I ground them up a bit in my Magic Bullet. Like other reviewers, I added some finely chopped onion and Worcestershire sauce; used Dijon mustard in the glaze and it was perfect!! So happy to have found his recipe—will have to double it next time so we have more leftovers. :-)

My husband wanted to experiment with cooking meatloaf on the Blackstone griddle. We chose this recipe as a base to start from. Doubled the recipe, reduced the milk a bit and added some breadcrumbs. The final result was absolutely delicious. The oats and cheese make it so moist. It did not taste oaty or cheesy And making it on the griddle created a nice crispy outside. I did not double the sauce by the recipe but rather used those 3 ingredients to taste and added it after they were fully cooked.
My hubby absolutely loves when I make these meatloaves. Any leftovers and I just cut one in half lengthwise to make his sandwich for work the next day.
i am a very picky eater so (i don't like cheese or mustard) i removed the cheese and mustard from the recipe and it was very good
It was very convenient to make and it was fun making. I like the design on how you can make them to little tiny footballs.
very good family enjoyed very much

The best meatloaf I've ever made and I've been making meatloaf for decades. My husband loves meatloaf. This is a great recipe. The texture is fantastic and the taste is soooo good. I made very minor changes. I used some beef bouillon in the milk mixture instead of salt. I also only used 1 tablespoon of brown sugar and supplemented that with some stevia. I used regular oatmeal and let it soak in the milk mixture about 20 minutes before adding the ground beef. Not sure the soaking is needed. Will try making this without that step.
Loved it!!
Wonderful recipe! I added garlic powder, pepper, and Worcestershire. I use muffin tins or a 9x13 when I double the recipe. Definitely give this one a try!

My go to recipe. I always double up, I use a meatloaf pan and ground turkey and make 2 big ones, not the little ones. I cook it at 365 for 50min to 1 hour (1 pound of meat per loaf), one loaf at a time. I use mozzarella or whatever cheese I have in the fridge. I serve it with white rice and butternut squash or just squash. It’s the perfect pair.
Hands down family favorite! I make it and there’s never leftovers!
Followed the recipe exactly and was very pleased with the way it turned out!
My kids love these. Made them a few times now. Sometimes in a muffin tin, but easier to clean on parchment paper in a 9x 13

First time attempting to make meatloaf. it was easier than I thought it'd be! I made the meat a few days before I cooked them. it was for a potluck at work so I actually made them smaller than the recipe says. I also used Italian breadcrumbs instead of the oats. I may try the oats another day, still not sure as I feel the Italian breadcrumbs gave it more flavor. It was a hit at work and will definitely be making these again!

Awesome meatloaf
So easy and very moist

My husband loves meatloaf. I’m not a big fan but I do like this meatloaf. I especially like the sauce on top, I also put some sauce on my plate to dip the meatloaf in. I add breadcrumbs instead of the oats I just prefer it that way. This is my go to meatloaf recipe.

This is the best meatloaf recipe I have found on Allrecipes! I have tried others which were ok..but not quite what I was expecting. As others have suggested, let the oatmeal and seasonings sit for at least 20 minutes to let the oatmeal soak up the milk. I made these in a muffin pan. It made 12 meatballs about 3-4oz. each. Baked these for about 30 minutes. Finally I found the right one!
I found this to be the most moist meatloaf I’ve ever eaten! I made it exactly like the recipe except I used muffin pans instead of loaf pans. Everyone went back for seconds so I know it’s a hit.
very tasty recipe! easy to make and the kids love it.
Easy to make.

These mini meat loaves were excellent! Even my adult son who thinks meatloaf was only popular to "our generation" and not enticing to his, ate 3 of them. I took suggestions from reviewers by adding sauteed onion and garlic, worchestire sauce, added extra spices and let the oatmeal mix set for 15 minutes, before mixing with ground beef, onion and garlic. I will definitely make this again. Oh, by the way, the only cheddar cheese I had was a taco mix, and it added extra flavor!!!
Simple and tasty! If there was a higher rating I would have given it! Thank you so much for sharing as this is now my new "family recipe."
I make these mini meat loaves in muffin tins and bake for about 30-35 minutes. My kids love them and ask for these often!

Well this is a meal that I researched and made all by myself. My family loved it. They were really amazed considering they thought all I ever made before was piggies in a blanket and beanie weenies. I even impressed myself.

This was awesome! 

Added about a quarter cup of chopped onion, one chopped celery stick, one grated carrot. Omitted cheese. Cooked them in a (regular sized) muffin pan. My 5-year old ate 3!

i measured the meat in a 1/3 measuring cup & rolled them in a ball, i sprayed the foil, i let the oat mixture sit in fridge for 10 min, i would keep mixing it up, then i got them on pan & put sauce on them, l put in fridge until i baked them, 30 min on 350, then the last 10 min i put more sauce on them, so yummy, be making them again
I used ground turkey instead but it was too moist so I added more oatmeal but you could taste the oatmeal.

I did as others suggested and mixed the eggs, cheese, milk, oats, & salt in a large bowl & let it sit for about 15 minutes. In the meantime, I placed diced onions & jalapeño peppers in a bit of butter and microwaved in a bowl for a few minutes until softened. I drained off the butter & cooled. I stirred the cooled peppers & onions into the cheese and oat mixture and then added the ground beef. I formed my beef mixture into four loaves, added the glaze, and baked all four in a glass baking dish for 60 minutes. This recipe was very very good, moist and flavorful. Also very easy to put together with on hand ingredients. My husband loved this meat loaf, & leftovers were great!

Made exactly as Tonya submitted. It is THE perfect meatloaf recipe and making them "mini" is brilliant. Delicious. Other reviewers mentioned that their kids or their husband absolutely loved them.....yup, here too. I did let the oatmeal soak in the wet ingredients for a bit, so there was no oatmeal-cookie-syndrome as someone reported, and I will never use another recipe for meatloaf again. Did I mention it was easy to prep? Yes it was, and the results were wonderful. Try it, don't change it. It is perfectly fine the way the recipe was submitted!
The flavor was OK, but the texture wasn't quite right (yes, I'm mindful to not overmix). I LOVE cheddar cheese, so it came as a surprise that I could take them or leave them.

We really like these. They are faster that regular sized meat loaf and "fun size". They don't have a lot of ingredients, so they are more low maintenance. The only problem is waiting 45 minutes for them to come out of the oven.

I have searched high and low for a delicious meatloaf when I found this and thought I'd give it a try. I knew I would't do the Mini's but keep it in the loaf pan. I doubled the recipe (freezes great!!) and froze half of it. My family loves this one. I did add garlic, onions and mushrooms. Highly recommend and have already saved it as a "go to" for our family.
Family favorite! I’ll add green/red pepper and onion. Works well to make ahead and freeze.

This was ok, but I made a few adjustments and will make even more next time if I make them again.
I found the meat mix was too wet, so I added bread crumbs a few tablespoons at a time until it would form with my hands. I added onion salt, (however next time I will use a cooking onion). I added about 1/2 tsp of black pepper. For the cheese, I used a 3 cheese blend. For the topping, I added about 1/2 tsp of garlic to the sauce. 
Well, the finished product was 8 mini meatloaves that kept their form. They were missing something and in my opinion, it is onion. Growing up, my Mom would melt cheese on top (not inside of the meatloaf.) I didn't mind that these had sauce on top, but oh my! Far too sweet! I am not a fan of catsup, so, in the future, I will use tomatoe paste or leave them plain. I would not recommend them as the recipe is written... with some changes it is worth trying.
These were Amazing! It was easy to do and flavorful.

I added about 1/2 package of hot breakfast sausage (pan) and some chopped onion. My husband loves this recipe. I have never been a meatloaf person, but this is good and I always eat more than I think I will. I also use a small meatloaf pan, and always make enough for two meatloafs, Good for another meal!
The sauce is nice. Like the sweet spicy flavor.
The family loved it!
I have been making this recipe for years and it is fabulous.
This was very good and easy to make. I did add some onion. Made them in muffin cups. My husband asked for more even though he says he hates meatloaf. I didn’t tell him it was meat loaf!
I made this, and my husband and I absolutely loved it. I didn't have any brown sugar, so I left that out. I also used brown spicy mustard instead of regular mustard.

These were so yummy! The only change I made was I used 1/2 cup of GF pretzel crumbs for the bread crumbs and didn't add any extra salt. I made 9 "muffins" and I lined my tins with parchment muffin paper. This is a keeper! Thanks.
Just added onions on top of each loaf. Did not put onions in the recipe.

The whole family loved this including my picky 7 and 5 year olds. My husband claimed it was the best meatloaf he ever had. The only change I made was that I used Bullseye bbq sauce on top because I was running out of time. Tasted great. I might use less salt next time as I found it quite salty.
Good flavor and easy. The sauce was too sweet; next time I'll cut the sugar in half. I substituted cooked rice for the oatmeal.
Made it for the first time, everyone enjoyed it, next time I think will double the meat and grave to have plenty of leftovers.
Love the topping - classic meatloaf! I substituted the oats for Italian bread crumbs and added a bit of BBQ sauce into my meat mixture to give it more flavor - Son and husband really loved it!!!

Great base recipe. I gave it 4 stars due to no one liking the ketchup topping. Like others I used a muffin tin and topped it with bbq sauce, A1, or whatever anyone was in the mood for. I have even changed the cheese I put in it.
Will make again, perfect for our family. But this batch is going for potluck Sunday.

I’ve made this a recipe a number of times and I’ve found that sautéing a small onion in butter and adding it in to the meat mixture makes the finished product twice as tasty. Also, I’ve always just used normal oats (not quick cooking) and it comes out great. Love the idea to use oatmeal instead of bread crumbs like most recipes call for!
Turns out great every time! Just looking for best way to prepare and freeze them for quicker meals in future
Everyone in my family enjoyed this. Kids loved the cheese included and adults the brown sugar mixed with ketchup. I did add garlic, seasoning salt and worcheschire

Sooo GOOD!
I just made this for my family. I’m not a big meatloaf fan so I hesitantly tried a bite and OMG, I LOVE IT!
I’m packing one for lunch tomorrow. 
I added finely chopped onions, Worcestershire sauce, garlic power. 
This is going to be my go to meatloaf recipe.
I am definitely making this one again.

Loved it, wouldn't hurt to add onion or garlic but I didn't miss it much! There is only 2 of us so I halved the recipe and used 1/4 cup of a mixed combo between instant oats and Italian bread crumbs. Texture was good and flavor was spot on! Will be making again!
Delicious! I don’t like meatloaf but this had enough sweetness yet not too much so it was great

Excellent recipe. My husband loves meatloaf, and for the most part, I don't, but these were juicy and delicious. I was a little hesitant about using oats instead of breadcrumbs, but these mini meatloaves are delicious!
Really like this recipe.
Delicious!! This is now in our regular meal rotation? I also use mushroom gravy sometimes instead of ketchup for a version of Salisbury steak.
